references.paper_title: Gender shades: Intersectional accuracy disparities in commercial gender classification
references.reason: This paper highlights the issue of bias in facial recognition systems, which is a relevant context for the current work on improving self-training under distribution shifts.

references.paper_title: Do Imagenet classifiers generalize to Imagenet?
references.reason: This paper challenges the generalization capabilities of widely used image classification models, motivating the need for robust methods like the one proposed in the current work.

references.paper_title: Benchmarking neural network robustness to common corruptions and perturbations
references.reason: This paper provides a benchmark for evaluating the robustness of neural networks, which is crucial for assessing the performance of self-training methods under distribution shifts.

references.paper_title: When source-free domain adaptation meets learning with noisy labels
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the challenges of self-training under distribution shifts, making it a highly relevant reference for the current work.

references.paper_title: Early-learning regularization prevents memorization of noisy labels
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of early-learning regularization, which is the foundation of the proposed Anchored Confidence (AnCon) method.
